physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Fever and peripheral muscle wasting; scattered rales on chest auscultation; diffuse lymphadenopathy in the cervical, axillary, and inguinal areas.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially CD4 count was 45 cells/mL, improved from a nadir of 7 cells/mL; clinically improved during antibiotic therapy for pneumonia, but 5 months later CD4 count dropped to 8 cells/mL.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: CD4 count increased to 121 cells/mL after starting antiretroviral therapy; serum HIV RNA levels decreased to undetectable levels.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Serum EBV DNA level became undetectable 2 months after starting antiretroviral therapy, and symptoms resolved; CT scan showed significant shrinkage of lymphadenopathy.
